Description: Fragment of rim of East Greek pottery bowl. Interior glazed with two white lines at rim; exterior glazed at rim, reserved below. One repair or suspension hole fully preserved and part of another, together with two seemingly aborted attempts. Incised inscription on outside.
Curator's comments: The wall is thicker than for an ordinary small bowl.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.088)
